result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K. Reuterskiold III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Shall pay costs within 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts.
Failure to Pay = 9 days DCJ w/h&t consecutive.

Shall serve 15 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 9/7/15.
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

Court reviews charges and penalties, def pleads guilty in 15CM60, def pleads guilty in 15CT204, court finds pleas made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty in 15CM60, court withholds a finding in 15CT204 and accepts the DPA, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant waives statement, court heard and sentence imposed.

Defendant Michael K. Reuterskiold in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The State proceeded with rebuttal testimony. Parties stip. that the CD shown today is the CD shown at the previous hearing.  Sgt. Dennis Walston was called, S/T. Video started at 2:29:16.  Court denied Defendant's motion and found reasonable grounds for the stop.  Defense requested the trial for 6-17-15 be rescheduled due to possible new charges pending.
